title: SMTP throws an exception in VS2017
body:
I've got an interesting problem with SMTP protocol in VisualStudio 2017.

Here is the snippet. 

            var client = new SmtpClient()
            {
                Host = "myHost.com",
                Port = 25,
                DeliveryMethod = SmtpDeliveryMethod.Network,
                UseDefaultCredentials = false,
                EnableSsl = false,
                Credentials = new NetworkCredential("login", "password")
           }

client.Send(mail) throws an exception that server requires a secure connection or user was not authenticated. When I switch EnableSsl = true, I get an exception that the server does not support secured connections.

The point is that it works with exactly the same set of settings in our previous project in VS2013. And everything is fine in Outlook.

Maybe some additional settings on IIS are required?

Does anyone know what can possibly cause that problem?
